Sys::Sem Class Reference

Documentation

This utilizes POSIX semaphores

Member Function Documentation

int Sys::Sem::close ( )

Close a named semaphore (use with open() NOT init())

int Sys::Sem::destroy ( )

Destroy an unnamed semaphore (use with init() NOT open())

int Sys::Sem::getvalue ( int *  sval)

Get the semaphore value

Parameters
svalA pointer to the destination to write the value
Returns
Zero on success
int Sys::Sem::init ( sem_t *  sem,
int  pshared,
unsigned int  value 
)

Initialize an unnamed semaphore

Parameters
semA pointer to the semaphore
psharedWhether or not semaphore is shared between another process
valueThe value of the semaphore
Returns
Zero on success
int Sys::Sem::open ( const char *  name,
int  oflag,
int  mode,
int  value 
)

This methods opens or creates a new semaphore

Parameters
nameThe name of the semaphore
oflagCreate/exclusivity
modePermissions
valueInitial value
Returns
Zero on success
int Sys::Sem::post ( )

This will increment the semaphore value allowing another thread/process to use the semaphore.

Returns
Zero on success
int Sys::Sem::timedwait ( const struct timespec *  timeout)

Wait for semaphore to become available with a timeout

int Sys::Sem::trywait ( )

Check to see if semaphore is available

static int Sys::Sem::unlink ( const char *  name)
static

Delete a named semaphore

inline

See getvalue()

int Sys::Sem::wait ( )

Wait for the semaphore to become available
